newsitem.title: UK: BT welcomes Hundt's comments on MCI merger.
newsitem.headline: BT welcomes Hundt's comments on MCI merger.

text.p: British Telecommunications Plc on Monday welcomed comments from the top U.S. phone regulator urging swift approval of its planned merger with MCI Communications Corp.
"Both BT and MCI are pleased by Federal Communications Commission (FCC) Chairman Reed Hundt's statement to move forward with the Commission's approval of the BT-MCI merger," a BT spokesman said.
"The announcement represents another step towards obtaining approval for the merger," he added.
Hundt had earlier said he personally believed the $21 billion merger was in the public interest and called on the FCC to approve it swiftly.
FCC approval of the deal -- announced last November -- is the last major regulatory hurdle for the merger of British Telecom and MCI, number two in the U.S. long-distance market.
However, there has been speculation that BT may seek to renegotiate the terms after MCI announced higher than expected losses in its expanding local telecoms business.
